top_procedures.description: Chronic care management services at least 20 minutes per calendar month
Established patient office or other outpatient, visit typically 25 minutes
Established patient office or other outpatient visit, typically 15 minutes
Annual wellness visit, includes a personalized prevention plan of service (pps), subsequent visit
Advance care planning by the physician or other qualified health care professional

Physician supervision of a patient receiving medicare-covered services provided by a participating home health agency (patient not present) requiring complex and multidisciplinary care modalities involving regular physician development and/or revision of c
Injection beneath the skin or into muscle for therapy, diagnosis, or prevention
Remote monitoring of physiologic parameters, initial supply of devices with daily recordings or programmed alerts transmission, each 30 days
Remote physiologic monitoring treatment management services, health care professional time in a calendar month requiring interactive communication with the patient/caregiver; first 20 minutes
Subsequent nursing facility visit, typically 25 minutes per day
Chronic care management services for two or more chronic conditions, additional 20 minutes of clinical staff time directed by health care professional, per calendar month
Aspiration and/or injection of large joint or joint capsule

Remote physiologic monitoring treatment management services, health care professional time in a calendar month requiring interactive communication with the patient/caregiver; each additional 20 minute
Vaccine for influenza for injection into muscle
Transitional care management services, moderately complexity, requiring face-to-face visits within 14 days of discharge
New patient office or other outpatient visit, typically 30 minutes
Administration of influenza virus vaccine
Testing of autonomic (sympathetic) nervous system function
Initial preventive physical examination; face-to-face visit, services limited to new beneficiary during the first 12 months of medicare enrollment
Subsequent hospital inpatient care, typically 25 minutes per day
